content:
As an AI language model, I do not have personal experiences or opinions, but I can provide general information regarding your questions.

For someone who suspects they may have a food allergy or intolerance, the best course of action is to consult with a healthcare professional, such as an allergist or a registered dietitian. They can help identify potential food triggers, diagnose any allergies or intolerances, and provide personalized recommendations for managing symptoms.

Some tips to consider before visiting a healthcare professional include keeping a food diary to track symptoms, avoiding self-diagnosis or elimination diets, and being prepared to provide a detailed medical history.

As for properly cleaning a leather couch, it depends on the type of leather and the type of stain or dirt. A general recommendation is to dust or vacuum regularly, wipe spills immediately, and use a leather conditioner to maintain the natural oils of the leather. However, for more specific instructions, it is best to refer to the manufacturer's care instructions or consult with a professional cleaner.
